H0.text: Its height increases when the velocity of an ocean wave decreases as it approaches a shore.

H1.text: Its height decreases when the velocity of an ocean wave decreases as it approaches a shore.

H2.text: Its length shortens when the velocity of an ocean wave decreases as it approaches a shore.

H3.text: It crests when the velocity of an ocean wave decreases as it approaches a shore.

A4.text: In other words, as the waves approach the shore and the water gets shallower, the waves get taller, slow down, and get closer together.

A5.text: As waves enter shallower waters, the decrease in group velocity caused by the reduction in water depth leads to a reduction in wave length Î».

A6.text: Wave height changes due to wave shoaling and refraction as the water depth decreases towards the coast.

A7.text: When the slope, or steepness ratio, of a wave, is too great, breaking is inevitable.
